profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-27 15:37:20 -0400.

did.unittitle: Darlington Hoopes papers
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Penn State University Libraries catalog via the link above. Archival collections may be housed in offsite storage. For materials stored offsite, please allow 2-3 business days for retrieval.
did.abstract: Darlington Hoopes (1896-1989) was a lawyer and Socialist Party official from Reading, Pennsylvania. Hoopes served as a member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives from 1930 to 1936, and later ran for Vice-President and President as a Socialist Party candidate. This collection contains materials that document Hoopes activism, his political career, and his work as a Socialist Party official.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creators of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Darlington Hoopes papers, HCLA 1883, Special Collections Library, Pennsylvania State University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Darlington Hoopes papers consist of materials that document Hoopes activism, his political career, and his work as a Socialist Party official for the Socialist Party (U.S.) (1917-1977), the Socialist Party of Pennsylvania (1920-1952), and the Local Berks Country Socialist Party of Pennsylvania (1910-1975). Political materials include legislative bills introduced as Hoopes as a member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives; campaign records for his vice-presidential (1944) and presidential campaigns (1952, 1956); correspondence and minutes of the National Executive Committee and the Young People's Socialist League; Socialist newsletters; and press clippings. Some potential areas of interest include correspondence and administrative records concering civil rights, equality before the law, fair housing rights, and discrimination in housing for Reading, Pennsylvania; as well as correspondence and photographs from a German prisoner of war held in the Soviet Union during World War II.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Darlington Hoopes (1896-1989) was a lawyer and Socialist Party official from Reading, Pennsylvania. Hoopes served as a member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives from 1930 to 1936. In 1944 Hoopes was the Socialist Party's Vice Presidential candidate, sharing the ticket with presidential candidate Norman Thomas. Hoopes was also the Social Party's Presidential candidate in 1952 and 1956.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged to the following series: Socialist Party (U.S.); Socialist Party of Pennsylvania; Local Berks County, Socialist Party of Pennsylvania (Reading, Pa.); Eastern Cooperative League; Pennsylvania Equal Rights Council; Reading-Berks (Pa.) Human Relations Council; microfilm.

odd.p: Original folder contents were photocopied and removed from the collection due to water damage and mildew.
